result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Benjamin J Waul was found guilty of OWI (5th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine of $800.00, plus DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements.  Monies to be collected by DOC from prison funds not to exceed 25%.  Balance to be paid while on Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay amounts in ful would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant which is nondischargable in bankruptcy.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain employment.  Be given job and vocational training.
Undergo a mental health evaluation. Follow thru with any treatment recommended.
No controlled substances or alcohol unless the controlled substances are prescribed by a duly licensed physician for defendant's mental or physical needs.
AODA assessment and treatment.  Urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to compete a Driver Assessment and Safety Plan.
Court ordered defendasnt to provide DNA sample.

/(2), received and filed.

Stipulation to defendant's prior four convictions of Operating While Intoxicated; and,
Stipulation that Analyst Jennifer Evans is an expert in the field of Toxicology and an expert in analyzing a sample using Headspace Gas Chromatography.

Defendant Benjamin J Waul in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  At the hour of 4:10 p.m., the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in verdicts of Guilty, as to Counts 1 and 2 which were then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdicts received and filed.  Court granted State's motion for judgment on the verdicts and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdicts.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction on Count 1 and ordered Count 2 dismissed, as a matter of law.

Defendant Benjamin J Waul in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury back in box.  State re-called Officer Whithee; Court reminded Officer Whithee he remains under oath.  State then calls Ms. Jennifer Evans, Analyst, Wisconsin State Crime Lab.  Stipulations read to the jury and into the record by the Court and received. State's exhibits #1,  #2, #4 - #9 offered and received. State rests, subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box.   Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and denied by the court.  Court has colloquy with defendant regarding his right to testify and his right to not testify.  Defendant stated he will not testify.  Court finds that defendant knowingly, intelligently and willingly waived his right to testify.  Jury back in box.  Defense rests.  Court ordered testimony closed.  Court instructed the jury.  Closing arguments by the State and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  At the hour of 3:20 p.m., the jury retired  to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Thomas Lamothe and Thomas Antkowski who were duly sworn for that purpose.

Defendant Benjamin J Waul in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury back in box.  Trial resumes with the direct examination of City of Greenfield Police Officer Borchardt, whom the Court reminded remains under oath. Sworn for the State:  City of Middleton Police Officer Daniel Whithee, formerly of the Greenfield Police Department.  At the hour of 11:55 a.m., the Court excused the jury for the noon hour with instructions to return by 1:30 p.m.  Jury out of box; Court in recess.

/received and filed.
Parties stipulate that on February 1, 2014 defendant was prohibited by law of having an alcohol concerntation of .02 or more.

Defendant Benjamin J Waul in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio and Melissa Fitzsimmons.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case recalled for the afternoon reporter.  Voir dire continued.  Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, Wisconsin qualified to serve as jurors in the above-entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed. Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by State and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Mr. John S.; City of Greenfield Police Officer Matthew Borchardt.  Exhibit #1 offered and received.  At the hour of 4:30 p.m., the Court excused the jurors for the evening with instructions to return by 9:30 a.m. on 10/02/14.  Jury out of box.  Court in recess.

Defendant Benjamin J Waul in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio and Melissa Fitzsimmons.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  11:45 a.m.  At the hour of 12:15 p.m, the Court gave preliminary instructions to the jury panel then excused the jury panel for the noon hour with instructions to return to Room 113 at 1:30 p.m.  Jury panel out of box.  Strikes for cause addressed on the record.  Court in recess until 1:30 p.m.

Defendant Benjamin J Waul in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties advise that case remains in trial posture. Case passed to receive jury verdict in other case and for staff to obtain jury panel for this case.
